instances.input: The sctp_getsockopt_assoc_stats function in net/sctp/socket.c in the Linux kernel before 3.8.4 does not validate a size value before proceeding to a copy_from_user operation, which allows local users to [Masked] via a crafted application that contains an SCTP_GET_ASSOC_STATS getsockopt system call.
instances.output: The vulnerability description is incomplete.

name: Complete the vulnerability description for the vulnerability withCVE-2014-0160
instruction: The following input is an incomplete vulnerability description. The [Masked] part is the missing content in the description. Complete the description based on the information currently provided.

instances.input: The (1) TLS and (2) DTLS implementations in [Masked] do not properly handle Heartbeat Extension packets, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information from process memory via crafted packets that trigger a buffer over-read, as demonstrated by reading private keys, related to d1_both.c and t1_lib.c, aka the Heartbleed bug.
instances.output: The (1) TLS and (2) DTLS implementations in OpenSSL 1.0.1 before 1.0.1g do not properly handle Heartbeat Extension packets, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information from process memory via crafted packets that trigger a buffer over-read, as demonstrated by reading private keys, related to d1_both.c and t1_lib.c, aka the Heartbleed bug.

name: Complete the vulnerability description for the vulnerability withCVE-2016-10049
instruction: To make the following vulnerability description more detailed, please fill in the missing elements at [Masked] to ensure the description fully reflects all aspects of the vulnerability.

instances.input: Buffer overflow in the ReadRLEImage function in coders/rle.c in [Masked] allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or have other unspecified impact via a crafted RLE file.
instances.output: Buffer overflow in the ReadRLEImage function in coders/rle.c in ImageMagick before 6.9.4-4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or have other unspecified impact via a crafted RLE file.

name: Complete the vulnerability description for the vulnerability withCVE-2014-7826
instruction: The following content is a vulnerability description missing a key attribute. The location of the attribute content is at [Masked] in the description. Complete this part to make the vulnerability description complete.

instances.input: kernel/trace/trace_syscalls.c in [Masked] does not properly handle private syscall numbers during use of the ftrace subsystem, which allows local users to gain privileges or cause a denial of service (invalid pointer dereference) via a crafted application.
instances.output: kernel/trace/trace_syscalls.c in the Linux kernel through 3.17.2 does not properly handle private syscall numbers during use of the ftrace subsystem, which allows local users to gain privileges or cause a denial of service (invalid pointer dereference) via a crafted application.

name: Complete the vulnerability description for the vulnerability withCVE-2010-3978
instruction: The following input is an incomplete vulnerability description. Generate the affected_product of the vulnerability and fill it in at the [Masked] position to complete the description.

instances.input: [Masked] exchanges data using JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) without a mechanism for validating requests, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information via vectors involving (1) admin/products.json, (2) admin/users.json, or (3) admin/overview/get_report_data, related to a "JSON hijacking" issue.
instances.output: Spree 0.11.x before 0.11.2 and 0.30.x before 0.30.0 exchanges data using JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) without a mechanism for validating requests, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information via vectors involving (1) admin/products.json, (2) admin/users.json, or (3) admin/overview/get_report_data, related to a "JSON hijacking" issue.

name: Complete the vulnerability description for the vulnerability withCVE-2013-0855
instruction: The following input is a vulnerability description missing the affected_product attribute. Generate the content and fill it in at the [Masked] position to make the description complete.

instances.input: Integer overflow in the alac_decode_close function in libavcodec/alac.c in [Masked] allows remote attackers to have an unspecified impact via a large number of samples per frame in Apple Lossless Audio Codec (ALAC) data, which triggers an out-of-bounds array access.
instances.output: Integer overflow in the alac_decode_close function in libavcodec/alac.c in FFmpeg before 1.1 allows remote attackers to have an unspecified impact via a large number of samples per frame in Apple Lossless Audio Codec (ALAC) data, which triggers an out-of-bounds array access.

The following description is missing one of these attributes, with [Masked] being the location of the missing content. name: Complete the vulnerability description for the vulnerability withCVE-2017-5029
instruction: A complete vulnerability description contains 5 key attributes: 'vector', 'attacker', 'cause', 'impact', 'affected_product'. The following is a vulnerability description missing the affected_product attribute, with [Masked] being the location of the missing part

instances.input: The xsltAddTextString function in transform.c in libxslt 1.1.29, as used in [Masked], lacked a check for integer overflow during a size calculation, which allowed a remote attacker to perform an out of bounds memory write via a crafted HTML page.
instances.output: The xsltAddTextString function in transform.c in libxslt 1.1.29, as used in Blink in Google Chrome prior to 57.0.2987.98 for Mac, Windows, and Linux and 57.0.2987.108 for Android, lacked a check for integer overflow during a size calculation, which allowed a remote attacker to perform an out of bounds memory write via a crafted HTML page.
